Posted: June 30, 2012
												One of the more genuinely strange games I've ever played--made all the more strange by the fact that it doesn't seem to be cribbing from any familiar sources (at least that I am aware of) to construct its game world. You play a guy who is cast out of his tribe after murdering your hermaphroditic Father/Mother under mysterious circumstances. As the game progresses you piece together the events leading up to the murder all while evading your siblings who are out for vengeance.Oh yeah, and it's also a first person beat em up. Despite being such a potentially disastrous genre hybrid (FPS fighting games have rarely worked) the fighting mechanics and controls are actually implemented fairly well. Likewise, the art direction is top notch. Ultimately the central game mechanics are a bit limited, but the game is smart enough to be brief, ending just before you start to get bored with things. I probably prefer "Rock of Ages" (by the same team), but this is a worthy first game from them.

Posted: November 26, 2016
												There aren't many first person fighting games around so this game feels rather unique, not only due to the gameplay but also its quite peculiar art style. While I feel the guns weren't really a necessary addition to the game they can be ignored for the most part if you'd prefer to just punch your way though the game. The story mode isn't all that long at around 3-4 hours but there is also a challenge mode that will give you quite a few more hours of play time.This game's style and unique gameplay make it particularly memorable, definitely worth the price especially at the low price that it is often discounted for.

Posted: January 10, 2012
												First person action/melee brawler in which you are one of the many children of Father-Mother and the only to know his dark secret. You must fight your brothers and sisters on your journey to confront Father-Mother. The story unfolds through cutscenes and flashbacks and is really eccentric. The areas and transitions feel quite disconnected initially, but near the end it starts coming together, things get interesting and the ending is satisfying.The combat isn't simple or intuitive and it'll take you a long time to learn advanced moves like dodging and countering attacks. Even the easiest difficulty will be frustrating if you don't master this system, so there is some skill involved. The game looks great with nice art, but the soundtrack is mediocre. It's short, lasting only a few hours if you don't try for achievements or challenge modes. There isn't a lot of depth here: no stats or inventory, it's 100% linear/combat and not much enemy or weapon variation, but still a good game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 21, 2015
												Zeno clash a first person shooter game set in a crazy some what cave man style world full of mystery and oddity. Sit back and gaze a pone this beautiful word while trying to not die by suicidal squirrels with bombs strapped to them.Game Play: 8The game play over all is a typical shooter for the most part. You get guns that you aim and shoot while running around. However this game adds in a nice elemental of first person melee combat. While this game is mostly about shooting than melee, The melee does add a nice touch to it but it also has it's own problems. While trying to melee it tends to feel off and a little clunky. However if you can get the melee down it's pretty fun. Some of the weapons you have are duel Pistols, a rifle, a crossbow, skull grenades, and more. Each has an alt fire that can be used. Pretty much like most other shooters it's mainly point and shoot not much else.There isn't many bosses to fight in game. However this game has one of my most favorite boss fights of all time. You'll find yourself fighting a blind bounty hunter who sits on top of a dinosaur's head that is at least fifty feet above you. Who gives you a rift to make it far for you to fight him. He sits up there shooting down at you. While tossing down squirrels with bombs strapped to them to chase you around and blow up that you have to kick around and avoid. Yes... you did read that right... mother ♥♥♥♥ing squirrels with mother ♥♥♥♥ing bombs strapped to there mother ♥♥♥♥ing backs! How can you NOT like this boss fight! It is so odd but yet so much fun!Story: 7The story takes place in a fictional fantasy world called Zenozoik, and begins in a town called Halstedom. You play as ghat the protagonist of the game, You are running away from your home village after being hunted by everyone from there. You found out father-mother biggest darkest secret and now in fear of your life. With your girlfriend Deadra you both leave the village to trivial to the end of the world to find answers. The story has a great build up. It makes you want to know whats going to happen, why you are being hunted, and what is this BIG secret that ghat know. However when it's finally revealed what it is, you kinda feel disappointed. You have this great build up of a story to be let down at the end.Graphics: 9The graphics really sets the mood. Each level you go to has it's over style and feel to it. The last level you where just in doesn't look like the one your current in. Each level feels different and fresh while keeping to the primal cave man feel of the game. The graphics are all over the place from bright looking to dark. Some how it all works out nicely. You get a real sense of this world.To be honest, the world to me feels like Alice in wonderland but cave man style. You have such a massive world with crazy looking characters from humans, to animals, to each scene. The graphics really sets this game up nicely. I can not express how much I love the graphics for this game and just how it all comes together to make this world. It's a pretty unique experience. To me this what really makes game shine the most.Music: 8The music does a good job keeping pace with whats going on. It helps to make the world to come alive with the background ambiance. The music does a great job to set each level up and keep it feeling unique as much as possible.Final Though:Even though the game play is like a lot of other shooters with some added melee. This game just shines when it comes to presentation of the world. You will find your self lost in this crazy mystical world. Wanting to see more of what this world has to offer. I was so immersed in the world alone just because how it looked and felt and with all the crazy characters you end up meeting just really pulls it together to make it feel so unique. I compare this world of alice in wonder land, though not as amazing as alice but it has the great mystical feel to it that keep you wanting more.However like I said before it kinda of falls off the story with a great build up with a disappointing ending. However the ending is better than some other games out there. I find this game a good game to play for any one who like first person shooters. However this game IS weird and odd. If you can't get behind outlandish things you may find your self not liking this game.I sat down and beat this game in one sitting. Took me roughly 6 hours to beat it. So over all I would recommend this most to most people.Also...mother ♥♥♥♥ing Squirrels with mother ♥♥♥♥ing bombs strapped to there mother ♥♥♥♥ing backs!Final Score: 8for more reviews and other fun things check out my tumblr. www.rogue32807.tumblr.com

Posted: February 15
												I picked up Zeno Clash after having already played the second game with a friend, and I can tell you, the second one is better. This entry is pretty fun, but it lacks the quality of storytelling, free-roaming mechanics and of course, 2-player coop. However, it is significantly more straightforward (and thus, shorter), and the guns can be reloaded, though they have a habit of being knocked out of your hands. They do less damage then in the second game, and the hammers are much more awkward to use. Generally it's much easier to just punch things- except for the obnoxious heavy fights, which require you to use the hammers.Still, without having played this one (or had someone explain the premise), the second game really would not make a lot of sense, given the weirdness of not only the setting and asthetic but the morality and motivations of its characters. Collectively, the series is certainly the most unique thing to come out of the Source Engine, and worth playing. I would advise you play this entry before the second game, however.

Posted: June 13, 2016
												Quick Summary: Zeno Clash is built on the Half Life 2 Source engine, so that should give you an idea what to expect in terms of graphics and hardware requirements. However in gameplay and art style the games are completely different. I gave Zeno Clash a try because my video card crapped out a while back and I wanted to try something less hardware intensive while I waited for a replacement. It was a fun game, but it’s definitely not for everyone.First off, note that the world of Zeno Clash is weird and alien while seeming like it could possibly be a post-apocalyptic Earth (it’s not). The “people” speak English but mix in strange words and phrases like it was an adaptation of a novel. Many citizens of this world are also a mix, of human and animal. Some of the people you’ll encounter are fully human while others look like bird men, elephant men, or just completely original beasts. The environment is sort of stone age with some odd guns/crossbows/magic thrown in (fish guns?). You play a human looking dude named Ghat who for some reason is being chased down by his former brothers and sisters. You and your one friend in the world are on a quest to bring justice to the children of Father/Mother (the main antagonist) even as these children fight you every step of the way.While I mentioned guns earlier, the game is mostly melee fighting, and you’ll need to get comfortable dodging and blocking blows from enemies, sometimes simultaneously from different sides.  The guns are mostly weak pea shooters but can be helpful if you get♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥off from trading punches with a bunch of cheaters. Unlike kung-fu movies, these guys like to all attack at the same time. There is some variety in enemy types, but they’re mostly the same fighting style with character appearances. It’s the really big dudes that you need to watch out for.Pros:+Weird story that keeps you thinking. You’ll probably spend a bunch of the time trying to figure out what’s going on, and what happened leading to Ghat’s predicament.+The melee fighting system is fun, though challenging since you’re playing in First Person Shooter perspective and can only really concentrate on one guy at a time.Cons:-The graphics are rather dated, since the game is pretty old-There’s no “easy mode” for people who just want to experience the story. The game’s difficulty can be brutal for new players at certain point. The challenge levels seem more frustrating than they’re worth, especially when you’re forced to fight a whole group at once, and your “target lock” messes with your repositioning efforts.Overall, if you’ve run out of games to play or just want to try something weird, you can do a lot worse than Zeno Clash.

												A loose connection of small corridors that are unreasonably padded with ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t. Oh yes, it's not only a first-person punch-'em-up, it also throws in wildlife for you to shoot with guns that deal small amounts of damage while taking their time to reload. If you thought you could punch the buggers with your mighty fists, think again: they spawn behind the walls of the level, so shoot away, chum.First-person fighting is rare in video games, and it's rare for a reason. If you're fighting more than one enemy at a time, which is always, you are bound to get blindsided and be interrupted mid-combo. You could keep your distance, keep everyone in your sights, use satisfyingly powerful melee weapons and win the encounter unscratched. Or you could not play this game and ultimately have a better time.

Posted: April 20, 2016
												If Tim Burton and Doctor Seus made a collaberation to make a FPS beat em'up, the Zeno clash would probably be it. Its a decent game at worst, but its enviroment can make it very distrating, yet this is a fairly good game. The story is pretty good (though alittle hard to follow since its definetly not in our world) and most of the characters are interesting, but not my favorite game of all. While I certainly don't love it, I don't recommend it to gamers who like fps, fighting type game, or just want a unique journey. Just remember, don't judge a game by its cover.

Posted: April 19
												This is a really interesting and entertaining game. I got this game on sale and wasn't expecting much but what I got was quite a surprise. It has a theme thats like a mix between the films MirrorMAsk and Beetlejuice. It's weird and it's designed well. It creates a really cool and trippy atmosphere and introduces you to a lot of original ideas and places without explicitly explaining them. Mechanicaly this game is at least entertaining. In some places the seams do show but it doesn't matter because im so curious as to what is going to happen next both in it's plot and with enemies. A lot of people warned that the comabt mechanics were very repetitive but I don't feel that way, it's more like it's simple to use but difficult to master. There's a lot more options than I expected and the game puts you in quite a few tense situations that demand quick response and timing. The highlight of this game is easily the characters which have some really bizarre design behind them and a hit and miss voice acting job that I personally enjoyed a lot. There's a surprising amount of depth to this world, especially for a game that's primarily about beating things up. Well done.PROS:Interesting worldWell designed charactersEntertaining mechanicsGreat atmosphere and aestheticCONS:The combat system isn't as seamless as it could beVoice acting can be bad in some placesThe occasional enemy or area that isn't really fun

												While I wouldn't say that Zeno Clash was the worse game that I had ever played, I will, in no way, provide the illusion that it is anywhere within the realm of an acceptable game. Zeno Clash boasts a difficulty ramp that is unleveled and radical, in addition to a storyline that is mediocre on a good day. The gameplay, while could be improved, is admittedly quite nice, and has a nice ebb and flow to it. However, this does not mak up for it's other lacking mechanics. In addition to all of this, for the amount it costs, it is a frustratingly short game, and lengthing it would also improve the value immensely.

content:
Posted: August 28, 2016
												Zeno Clash is a very interesting title. It takes place in a world that you aren't told much about, and it's a world filled with various types of humanoids, some human and some half animal. You play as Ghat, a man on the run alongside a friend and accused of murdering a creature called "Father-Mother". It sounds like an interesting story, and while the story itself and what actually takes place is good, the writing and the voice acting are not all that great and it detracts from what would otherwise be a decent tale. However, the graphics and gameplay both make up for these issue. The game is beautiful looking with a unique looking world with beautiful skies and landscapes, and you'll never see the same thing twice so you're never bored with what you see. This is good, as the game is played entirely from a first person perspective.The game is best described as a beat em up, as you progress, face hordes of enemies, and progress to the next segment. You don't learn new moves or upgrades as you go, but that is fine as you do well with what the game gives you. It's solid with blocks, dodges, punches, kicks, and throws along with hand to hand weaponry and guns. It's hard to be bored as you progress the game's campaign. There are four levels of difficulty, with my playthrough happening on Hard but there is also Easy, Normal, and Extreme. Hard mode presented a great challenge and it took about eight hours to get through it. Once you're done, there is a set of challenges to go through with a fixed difficulty to try your hand at.It's a beautiful, brutal, knock you down your♥♥♥♥♥recommendation. Give it a shot.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 14, 2014
												TL;DR – The most this caveman brawler gives you in terms of plot and setting exposition is a moderately-short blurb on the game’s store page. Also, one of the enemy models closely resembles a *ToTaLLy MEtAl* version of the Swedish Chef from “The Muppet Show”. Recommend. Onto the review:It’s actually to Zeno Clash’s benefit that it doesn’t really explain itself outside of the basic gameplay mechanics, which are simplistic but nevertheless require a bit of finesse if you’re playing on any of the higher difficulties. To elaborate, combat is your typical mouse-bound primary-light-attack, secondary-heavy-attack affair, utilizing the spacebar for blocking and evading. Uncoordinated lout that I am, this was interpreted as “spam the secondary/primary and run around like a chicken sans head”. This "style" of gameplay actually worked for me, thanks to the normal-level difficulty setting I was playing on, in addition to smartly-placed health items in each area. Unfortunately, this is also the likely cause of the game’s growing tediousness later on, as, outside of a few close calls and even some deaths, I was just smashing through opponents in area after area. To offset this, there is some variety in the stages; for example, a brawling sequence being followed by a shooting gallery level, or some other contrivance (like using a magic torch to light up pyres and moving statues alike). And the guns, oh the guns. Indeed, the weapons in Zeno Clash most succinctly sum up the game’s overall art aesthetic; the closest comparison in décor is that of “The Flintstones”, with its brightly-colored yet naturalistic designs. Hell, there’s even dinosaurs (or at least large reptiles resembling them) in a level or two. The guns themselves specifically piqued my interest, as the idea of a primeval-era slugthrower is just surreally fantastic. For example, the pistols, which basically appear to be carved shells with a bunch of nails and rocks stuffed into them, are just fun to look at and use in all of their pea-shootery goodness (which may also explain why I keep running into the same named characters again after I so thoroughly obliterate their asses). Besides the art design, this sense of backwards absurdity is ingrained in the plot and characters; outside of the aftermentioned blurb, the game leaves it up to the progression of the narrative itself to explain what the hell is going on, eking out small bits of info through dialogue and actions. It's a refreshing break from grandiose blocks of text that describe a game's lore in exacting detail, but I fear the world of Zeno Clash might still be too alien to experience without detailed explanation for some players. At the same time however, it's that same feeling of unknowingness that may spur other players (myself included) to push on and immerse themselves in the absolute weirdness that is this game.  Final words: Zeno Clash is so aesthetically "out there" that it may dissuade players from digging into it, but the fairly-conventional combat system, in addition to a relatable (if somewhat vague) storyline, signifies that this 5ish-hour-long brawler is still worth playing for a couple of bucks.

content:
Posted: December 18, 2016
 My Experience Playing this game on my own was impossible to do in one sitting. I desperately gasped after something real to look at after 20, or so minutes, because it felt suffocating. In order to complete the game I had to hold my breath as I progressed. After I ran out of air, I'd have to escape and take a real breather. This isn't real. This isn't real. This isn't real. Graphics The graphics look really good and it utilizes the Source Enging to it's fullest potential to deliver something unseen before. It does this at the same time as it provides solid performance. Gameplay You get to approach this game with both melee and different weapons. Each one feels distinctly unique and fun to use. The guns are not restricted to only shooting, since they can be thrown, providing a useful stun if you've run out of ammo. Ammunition is pretty rare to come by, so you'll see yourself using anything to win a fight.The melee combat is where this game shines, though. It's one of the first that defined a proper melee combat system in first person. It's complex, fun and rewarding as you learn to use it. You dodge, block, kick and punch your way through enemies. Story This game would be nothing without it's story. It's a part of what makes it so hallucinating. If you feel like it's normal, then you're not. Summarization An absolutely great game which I definitely can't reccomend enough. The price is ludicrous at 9,99€ for this masterpiece. At sales it goes down by 90% to 0,99€. You have literally nothing to lose but your sanity, if you isolate yourself with this game. Don't isolate yourself with this game. Remeber that This isn't real. This isn't real. This isn't real., or society will probably have to euthanize you for your own good.  Score Survives the test of time  7.8

content:
Posted: September 7, 2014
												I don't want to write a terribly long review of this game, because frankly I don't think it's deserving of one.  I started off rather curious and open-minded and felt that I was initially rewarded by a quirky but fun game.  The storyline had me intrigued, and as I continued to suspend disbelief and ignore a handful of "game logic" moments and repetitive fighting, I had hope that things would get better soon.  I was terribly mistaken.  After about 4 hours of gameplay, it feels like the dev team ran out of ideas and money.  Characters you've already fought are thrown back at you time and time again, and the story completely falls apart.  The ending is without a doubt the worst ending I've ever encountered in a video game.  The game rewards you for believing in it's surreal world by kicking you straight in the nuts as you realize all of your confusion was entirely justified.Unless you love the beat em up style and are prepared to fight the same characters using the same moves over and over and over again, AND can ignore massive plot holes, bad voice acting, and an unbelievably stupid story do NOT buy this game.  Not even on sale.  I chose to play this game on stream, and it was just frustrating, stupid, and the ending was unbelievably unsatisfying for everyone who watched.♥♥♥♥ing Rubik's Cube

content:
Posted: January 13, 2014
												Nothing is sense and everything is ♥♥♥♥. Great environments, good enough graphics, good combat system with responsiveness and a no ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t feel. Normal or "Hard" mode is not very hard at all. Brawlers IMO are hard to balance but these devs did an ok job of it. Difficulty is badly done with + or - enemy damage. The AI is ok but nothing special. I found myself playing through looking forward to the next piece of scenery or story. The story is not good, but it is gripping as you just want to make sense of it all. I usually don't care much for the gameplay style of brawlers but I cannot say I disliked Zeno Clash at any point. The combat had adequate depth but my number one reason for playing through the game was for that fantastic art direction. It statisfied me.If the price is low, you want an acid trip gangbang, and like brawlers you could pick this up without regret.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 24, 2014
												Oh, beautiful Zeno Clash..Zeno Clash is probably the only First Person Brawler in existance, and it does it oh so well. Instead of holding a gun, you have fists, and those fists hammer into enemies' faces ruthlessly. There are grabs, palm strikes, kicks, parries.. finishing moves.. Oh, and also guns, though you rarely get the chance to use them. The game has quite a high learning curve, but as soon as you get it down, I've found that it is one of the more enjoyable combat systems I have had the pleasure of playing with.The world of Zeno Clash is also vibrant and full of unique characters. The one who struck me the most were the Corwid of the Free, who are all obviously clinically insane in their single-mindedness. They do things because they do them. Examples being that one only wanted to walk in a straight line, another only wanted to eat people because that's what he did, and another wanted to be invisible, so he removed the eyes over everything that could see him, including his own. The art department really outdid itself on character design, and there isn't a single character in the game that could be classified as 'bland'The game also features an arena mode, which is probably best played after a first playthrough to get the basics down. All in all, this game was worth every cent. Get it if you want something new (and disturbing)!

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 23, 2013
												Here's a game you should definitely try! It's both great and well... incredibly average, but it's satisfying from start to finish.This is a short game, you can easily complete it in about 3 hours. It's a kinda sloppy melee first-person brawler.  Its combat system isn't bad, but it gets clunky at times, specially in group fights. However, punching enemies into a 5 meter flight makes you feel like a badass. And the ragdoll physics on the corpses are a nice touch as well. I haven't played Zeno Clash 2 yet, but I will soon enough, and I assume the combat system has been polished since 2009, although I've heard it focus too much on team fights, which is where the clumsiness comes in... But I digress. The game shines in its world and characters, which are all really weird, but at the same time, charming. They present neat ideas that feel like they should have been much more explored and fleshed out, but everything seems experimental here, hence its length.For example: "The Corwids are not slaves of reality, so they can be insane. Oxameter walks in a straight line without letting letting anything change his path... and that's what Oxameter does." There are other Corwids with interesting... "features", so I'd definitely recommend picking this up if you're interested in them alone.Now, another problem I have, in regards to the exploration of the world, is that, since the game goes from one arena to the others, you barely have any time to explore the areas and take the time to appreciate the world they've created. While you're in combat, you'll be busy to look around, and the scenes end as soon and you beat everyone up. This still leaves you with an idea of what it is, but too vague for my liking. Again, I hope Zeno Clash II solves this "issue".Voice acting is pretty bad, but it's bearable, and didn't ruin the overall experience for me. The cutscenes follow the same route, with some cheesy animations, but again, that wasn't my reason to be playing the game, so it didn't really make much of a difference.So, for the conclusion. If you're interesting in world, creature and character design, this is definitely a must-buy. They've done a great job there, I thoroughly enjoyed it!  If you're coming for the combat system, or a grand scale story... well, you'll not find it here, not quite. Still, I'd encourage you to pick it up on a sale, since it's a very interesting game to play.Well, I'm off to play Zeno Clash II now, I'm definitely interested in what comes next. Cheers!

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 19, 2014
												PROS:  Artwork of the level designs is SURREAL and otherworldly (no wonder it was nominated for an award); good ability to fight with hands and feet as well as use of crossbow slingshots, "pea shooters" and melee; voice acting is generally good;  music generally good (although I turned it WAY down for most of the game).CONS:  Poorly-written story makes no sense; tries to be some kind of Aesop's Fable, only without the fable (i.e. no moral being taught);  somewhat repetitive fighting, as the same enemies you just KO'ed over a half a dozen times or more already keep showing up again and again throughout the game (gets tiresome).This Source-Engine-driven game's fantastic environment makes up for its weak, nonsensical story.  It had the potential to be something a LOT greater than it turned out to be.  Without disclosing any major spoilers, let me just say that once you get to the ending, you'll realize that the whole game takes place in some sort of endless time-loop, with Ghat (the protagonist) being the victim of a false accusation...  You'll also come to realize that the creature called Father-Mother is being "outed" (which is the game's sole redeeming aspect)... And if all that brawling was still not enough for you, there are post-game Tower levels (multi-level arenas) where you can duke it out to your heart's content.  Personally, after two playthroughs, I had had enough already...  Overall, it's a "refreshingly-unique" kind of game, and a recommended play.  Check it out. ---Additional note:  For all you other "discerning" gents out there who prefer to see beautiful women in games dressed a little more "interestingly", there is a mod available for Daedra that accomplishes just that quite nicely.  Without giving the links, do a search for "Zeno Clash - Deadra Mod" (found  on Fileplanet dot com), then run it with the free Texmod app (dmcmods dot com).  Works well.   (Disclaimer:  I have no affiliation with either Fileplanet or DMCmods).Enjoy.  ;-)

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 14, 2016
												My experience with Zeno Clash was really strange. When I started, almost from very beggining I was put in fight, after two or three fights I closed game. I was wondering, when I will play it again. Combat system in Zeno Clash isn't bad - it's fine but also very annoying. I can't count how many times I got attacked from behind, but that's not what was annoying, the thing that comes after - not sure if it's bug, or if it should work that way, but almost everytime my character was performing once again last action. If fighting, in this kind of game, doesn't bring much pleasure then what is point of playing? This is easy question - THE WORLD AND CHARACTERS LIVING IN IT. This is most interesting part of game. I love every place and character this game have. With every next hour I wanted to know more. I would really love to see Zeno Clash as adventure game. I know I would have much more fun exploring new places, talking around and such than fighting. Well, that's just my opinion. If you love exploring bizzare worlds - Zeno Clash is good for that. Still, there is plenty of fighting, which can be hit or miss in case of Zeno Clash. In my case, it was sadly a miss.

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 21, 2016
Product received for free
												Well, I did play the entire game all the way though once on the middle diffuculty (describe as hard, mobs do normal damage).  Only took me 3 hours to beat.  I like that that it was short.  I have grown up enough that I don't have time to play games so being able to sit down and play one all the way through in one saturday is nice.  The story was, well it kept me hooked, but I wouldnt say it was good.  The world you are thrown in is pretty intriguing and interesting.  While the graphics are subpar (like most indy games) I was still able to be fully immensed in this place that resembled to me like a nuclear fallout (although it was never described as such).  The creativity that went into the world was the main thing that held my attention for the entire game.That being said, the gameplay was nothing to ride home about.  It had one of the better takes on hand to hand combat than any game I have played, but to be fair I have never played a game with hand to hand combat that I enjoyed.  I found myself always grabing a gun every chance I could and the guns were... well... how to describe it.  Appearently in this world guns are hard to find, so they are instead made out of very random things and very creatively done at that.  I found them to feel somewhat lacking though.  The game was entirely focused on hand to hand combat except one instance where you had to basically "target practice" as the acheivement suggest (definitely my favorite part of the game), while another instance was focused on flinging fire from your torch.  All in all, the story was pretty lame and gameplay nothing to brag home about, so I would probably not tell my friends to go out and buy it.  It was a nice free addition that came bundled with something i wanted.

number of helpful: 3 of 7 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 27, 2014
												This is easily the worst game I've ever played...ever.The whole entire game feels like it was created by a team of people who have never played a game before, or at least a good one. The lock on system is atrocious. You're stuck fighting one guy while three other enemies are all taking swings at you that you can't see coming, nor block. You're fighting the combat/lock on system more then you're fighting enemies. Also you get a power attack (right click) but don't even bother with it since the enemies ALWAYS dodge it so it's useless.The boss' in this game are laughable. I beat most of them by punching then running. Stick and move, there's no variation. The story is just trying to hard to be different, or abstract but it's neither. It's like a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ Oddworld without any substance. The graphics look like they were thrown together hastily. It's just a complete package of dumb. The worst game ever, and the sad part is it has a sequel. Anachronox has no sequel, Beyond Good and Evil has no sequel but THIS game has a sequel.

number of helpful: 3 of 7 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 26, 2013
												Sort of hate it.It's a cool concept, but in a game with an incredibly crappy story, it really needs solid mechanics to be pulled off.It's buggy and annoying, the combat is repetitive, and frankly it's too difficult.It's also childish that the game starts on "hard" where the enemies do normal damage, but allows you to turn it down to "normal" so they do less. Note that turning down the difficulty doesn't really help. The enemies are still pretty annoying.It would be fine if the enemies were smarter and fought you in a 1v1, but it's either 3 annoying enemies with guns shooting you (seriously, the guns can be fun when you have them, but when an enemy has them it's absolute bull. A full clip of the dual pistols in the hands of an enemy will take about a third of your health. They practically never miss.) Any time you DO fight 1v1 it's versus a heavy enemy who you can ONLY fight with a buggy "heavy weapon" with a ridiculous hitbox and huge input lag, to which if you are ever infront of the enemy it will always block it and counterattack.That said, even in the 1v1s the game will randomly decide to throw some random trash mob at you midway through the fight just because trying to deal with their ♥♥♥♥♥♥ mechanics isn't enough, you now have to use an incredibly slow weapon to kill an immediately respawning fast-attack enemy, in order to get a few attacks on the enemy who likes to sit there and do nothing but block your attacks in order to progress through the ♥♥♥♥♥♥ story.Maybe Zeno Clash 2 would be better JUST because of the multiplayer (I believe it's coop) so that you can have a fair fight for once.Sorry for the rant, this game♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥me off, how was this released in 2009.

content:
Posted: January 21, 2014
												This game was in my library for a very long time so I decided to give it a try. Now this game was by far the most strangest, out-there game, I have ever laid eyes on. The creatures are disturbing and crazy. The story was a bit confusing and bland, so its safe to say they really banked on the mind-numbing "acid-trippy" backdrop to sell the game. Visually the game wasn't bad per say, but it was developed on the Source engine, so obviously, it had a good platform to start from. I would like to say I was on the fence for this game, but I really wasn't. While playing I felt a longing for the end of the game. Once it was over, it left a empty..."What the f*** did I just play" feeling. I can't say I'd recommend this game to anyone, but I have to give it some points to originality.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 13, 2012
												There's a good game buried somewhere in here. The mechanics are great and the combat seems like what Dead Island was trying to achieve. Sadly the art director from this project was given nothing but a box of crayons and apparently M. Knight Shyamalan was hired to write what this game laughably calls a story. This is the single most unpleasant game to look at I've ever played. The scaling is awful and every character has hit the lowest point of the uncanny valley. Nearly everything is this game is unsettling to look at which would be great for a horror game but definitely not here. Zeno Clash proudly wears its pretentious art house mask, but unlike Braid, doesn't have the engaging story or gorgeous visuals to back it up.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 30, 2011
												Zeno Clash is a first person "brawler" set in the most bizarre universe I have ever experienced.  The setting is a tribal culture, and the story revolves around the main character being accused of murder.  Weapons are sparse and primitive; the highlights are definitely on the "brawling", fighting hand to hand.  The moves and timing can be hard to learn at first, but beyond the learning curve engagements are very satisfying.  Levels are linear and boss fights are varied in execution.  The visuals and characters though MUST be experienced.  Its a short romp although there are some challenges to complete.  Worth a try for sure.

content:

												"Its a first person brawler! How unique!!" I thought to myself, until I saw the guns. Guns that stunhit. Guns whose stunhit can be better utilized by enemies because they outnumber you. There's even literally a boss that requires you to use a gun to hit them. From long range. With a shotgun. While there's a constant stream of distraction (exploding squirrels that you need to kick away) to prevent you from being able to aim. "So artsy~" the critics say. What a load. The game was interesting, but it got horrible in a ♥♥♥♥ing hurry. Who did this? I want names.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 6, 2016
												No. Just, no. Absolutely nothing in this game makes any damn sense. The most mind-boggling thing so far is how this has a rating of 85%.The visuals are interesting, and the music reminds me of Diablo at times, but then that's about it. The voice acting is atrocious, the gameplay is severely lacking and repetative, and I'm not even sure if there's an actual story, despite their efforts.There's only so much an indie or 'non A+++' game can get away with before you have to stop treating it like a child's kindergarten project, giving it A's for effort. The one time I thought the game was going to do something interesting, or reveal what the actual plot was about, and it just immediately shoehorns you into a boss fight - the same exact one that you've already done half way through the game. That's all that ever happens; cutscene, pointless fight. Cutscene, pointless fight. Do you get to do anything to advance the plot? Explore? Manage an inventory (re: choose what weapon to carry around with)? No. Every 'level' or whatever you want to call it will choose how you will start the fight, that means it will either take away anything you were carrying at the time, or give you a random weapon and make absolutely zero effort on explaining why this happens.The majority of the game, you have a companion... but does she do anything to be even remotely helpful? No. During one of the boss fights that has no rhyme or reason (like much of the game), this character perches herself up on a vantage point with a rifle, and what does she do? SHOOTS THE CRABS SKUTTLING AROUND... I'M DEAD SERIOUS. All she ever does is gets up on a vantage point, and does virtually nothing. You can hear her shooting at times, but at what, I have no idea.For the first hour or so, I kept asking myself... why did I get this game? And then, the question turned into: what the hell is this game even trying to do? I don't understand how or why this game has a sequel. I really don't. I forced myself to play through to see what the hub-bub was about, and was just as disappointed at the end as I was at the start. Easily the longest, least-deserving 3 1/2 hours of my life.A game needs more than interesting visuals and a 'well, they tried' attitude to warrant being as popular and highly praised as this one is. Please avoid at all costs, even if that cost is $1.99. It's not worth it.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 27, 2014
												I completed the game and tried bit of the arena, I like the impression it made on me.Don't expect 3rd gen quality. Textures lack a bit here and there, same as the world detail level which is quite simplistic overall but with use of blur, fog, lightning and interesting surreal design the game manages to conceal it perfectly and it definitely works for me. Character design is again simplistic yet amazing and fairly high detailed at some parts.Combat and enemies are bit repetitive but challenging in a good way. Game sets you up against them in slightly different situations and environment and again manages to conceal what it’s lacking.Story is nicely confusing but lacking emotionally a little. Then again it's a surreal universe and who know what mentality and emotional approach people might have there.Music is nothing out of the ordinary and could be better but it corresponds with the action rather well.Game doesn’t seem to suffer from any major bugs, definitely nothing that couldn't be solved with quick load. I got stuck once trough the cause of the whole game and once my enemy got stuck outside of the fight area and I had to bounce grenades of the wall to kill him around the corner as he was out of my reach.This brings us to the level design that is simplistic, linear and not at all open world like but it serves the games purpose. Which in my opinion is to tell a surreal story that you could then tell to your children for not such a good night sleep :) Story is interesting and bit surreal with a solid ending, yet PG12 or less. The game overall is very short which is disappointing, but it includes survival arena like mode for those that would like to experience the game bit more.Overall 7 out of 10. Game is solid but lacks in graphic, music, emotional storytelling, enemies and weapon varieties level design and game length. Seems it is a low budget game, yet it has a similar effect on me that Dreamfall - The Longest Journey or Bioshock had back when I played them - somehow enchanting. It manages to conceal its flaws with overall good concept, solid design and interesting fighting system. It brings a bit of fresh air in to the FPS genre, and with its low price it's a must have.

content:
Posted: May 27, 2014
												Zeno Clash is a short, but sweet game that does first-person melee combat better than any other game I've played. The punches, dodges, and kicks all feel like they have real weight and every hit just feels right. Once you've beaten the main campaign, there are some great challenge maps to play, making for good replay value. The campaign is very short (4 hours), but I found it has no filler and every moment is pure gold. Story-wise, Zeno clash is very creative and fun, with lots of interesting characters and twists to it. The visual style is unlike anything I've seen, and is very cool. Overall, you can't go wrong with this game.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 26, 2014
												Easily one of the most original experiences I've ever seen in a PC game. Making a beat-em-up in a first-person situation was about as clunky as you could imagine, but it came out much better than you'd think. Still, it felt unfair and needlessly frustrating at times. It has a very 80s feel with the design looking like it came out of The Labyrinth and Dark Crystal with the tone of Mad Max and Water World. Zeno Clash is beautifully rendered too with the scenery and chaacter models ooking like they could actually have been made out of clay. The combat, which is the core gameplay, was solid and satisfying despite it's short comings. Never thought I could use the mouse and it feel like I'm really punching somebody! The voice acting is very flat and the story is very shallow, but the story didn't need to be very deep and the awkward voice acting added to the surreal and abstract feel of the whole thing. The music fit the atmosphere and the mood perfectly, similar to Abe's Odysee. I felt like that's probably the sounds you would hear in that universe. Zeno Clash is an easy recommendation for anyone looking for a fresh first person experience with some unique challenge.

content:
Posted: December 27, 2014
												I completed the game and tried bit of the arena, I like the impression it made on me.Don't expect 3rd gen quality. Textures lack a bit here and there, same as the world detail level which is quite simplistic overall but with use of blur, fog, lightning and interesting surreal design the game manages to conceal it perfectly and it definitely works for me. Character design is again simplistic yet amazing and fairly high detailed at some parts.Combat and enemies are bit repetitive but challenging in a good way. Game sets you up against them in slightly different situations and environment and again manages to conceal what it’s lacking.Story is nicely confusing but lacking emotionally a little. Then again it's a surreal universe and who know what mentality and emotional approach people might have there.Music is nothing out of the ordinary and could be better but it corresponds with the action rather well.Game doesn’t seem to suffer from any major bugs, definitely nothing that couldn't be solved with quick load. I got stuck once trough the cause of the whole game and once my enemy got stuck outside of the fight area and I had to bounce grenades of the wall to kill him around the corner as he was out of my reach.This brings us to the level design that is simplistic, linear and not at all open world like but it serves the games purpose. Which in my opinion is to tell a surreal story that you could then tell to your children for not such a good night sleep :) Story is interesting and bit surreal with a solid ending, yet PG12 or less. The game overall is very short which is disappointing, but it includes survival arena like mode for those that would like to experience the game bit more.Overall 7 out of 10. Game is solid but lacks in graphic, music, emotional storytelling, enemies and weapon varieties level design and game length. Seems it is a low budget game, yet it has a similar effect on me that Dreamfall - The Longest Journey or Bioshock had back when I played them - somehow enchanting. It manages to conceal its flaws with overall good concept, solid design and interesting fighting system. It brings a bit of fresh air in to the FPS genre, and with its low price it's a must have.

content:
Posted: June 28, 2014
												Overlooked often. This is a bizarre world, unusual game, and even stranger story. The setting, and most characters, intertwining the events you move through, pretty linear, feels a bit dreamy, stream of conscious, Alice in Wonderland, and frankly, like a freak dream or hallucination.The combat scenarios each have a twist and a few optional weapons but mostly its sock'm and bop'm down which is an oft underused style. No two enemies are exact clones, and the game is so relatively short that the combat won't get stale. Some fights can be more challenging than others but none are really a joke with all quite fun, and a few can be a challenge till you find the tactics and approach.Pretty short with some re-playability but what is there had a lot of attention poured into it. Definitely a refreshing change and change of pace over many games and worth a look for just the art and story alone.

content:
Posted: December 18, 2013
												Zeno Clash... Ah Zeno clash... The game is about you (the person who you control) killing you're mother. So you along with a friend try to escape you're siblings, who are angry at you for killing Farther-Mother. You hope for better things  along the way but you soon realise you carn't escape you're siblings. Soon, you find yourself freeing a man-type-creature who has been capture for years. He then helps you get home. Along the way you are hunted down bye the Hunter who the Family paid to kill you. And again, you're siblings. you then return home and fight one on one with Farther-Mother. Thus at the end a big secret is revealed rolling into the second game of the series. I have enjoyed Zeno Clash, but, howether it is not perfect, with buggy fighting controls etc. it is sometimes difficult to fight in Zeno clash, and the short campain but, if you can get past that then it's actually pretty fun.I am ready to play the second one!I'll give the game a 8/10I hope you find this review helpful. Thanks

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 29, 2014
												Zeno Clash is one of those games that I only played for a little bit, but I was glad for it. It's also a game that I might not fully understand, but I'm happy for its mere existence. It's so different and unusual in approach and design, yet it works rather well. Stuff like this proves that games don't all need to be high fantasy or military shooters to work.The combat is simply awesome and sublime. Few games really give me that impression of walloping a mob in the face, but this game definitely delivers. I can feel that satisfying recoil with every hard crack of Ghat's fist, and kneeing a baddie in the face is a treat. Fighting is by no means easy, and some enemies are clever and know how to dodge and counter some of the moves. Others are armored, skillful or just plain weird, and you have to determine the correct approach to damage them effectively. This makes for a very tactical game where you have to be able to plan and improvise your attacks, as well as manage your health and stamina.Weapons are provided, but just don't give that same amount of gratification. Luckily they are only needed for a couple key sections of the main game, and are completely optional at all other times. Most enemies can be beaten with bare knuckles.My only gripe is really the length of the main campaign. It's a bit shorter than I would have preferred, considering the potential depth of the game's mechanics, not to mention the sheer alien beauty of the game's world. If nothing else I wanted to know more and more about the world, its bizarre creatures and history. Maybe this is expanded upon in the sequel. There is, however, an interesting "challenge" mode, which consists of a series of matches that get progressively harder, with the player facing various squads of enemies based on characters faced in the main game. Because of it's own length and the difficulties that can be reached, I get the impression that this tower mode is the "real" game, and the campaign is more of a lengthy tutorial.This title isn't for everyone. This game requires some good tactical instincts and the combat can be a bit slower-paced that some would prefer, but if you like the tribal-punk setting and enjoy first-person brawling, then you'll get your fix here.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 7, 2014
												This game is cleverly designed. I was surprised to find that the first person fist fighting style of the game was executed so well that rather than being put off by the fists flying in front of my face, I ended up becoming absorbed in each fight, physically moving in my chair to dodge left and right. Besides clever game design, the art style is remarkably unique. Characters, landscapes and monsters all look very strange, but always familiar. The story was also unexpectedly good. The protagonist presents the player with an intriguing new perspective. I've never seen similar in any other game. I don't understand why this game isn't more well known. I recommend this game to anyone who enjoys surrealist art, anthropology or beating people up.

content:
Posted: August 3, 2016
												What most games get wrong, this game gets incredibly right. Zeno Clash mixes FPS elements and a heavy combat system to make you feel like the ultimate tribal kung fu badass. The story can seem a bit off at first and the universe takes quite a long time to get fully immersed into. I can understand why the odd creatures and mishapen worlds can seriously throw people off but if you give this game a chance you will not regret it. Besides questionable voice acting and a somewhat short length, Zeno Clash provides enough story, group combat scenes, and boss battles for any fan of both the FPS and Beat-Em-Up genre to feel completely satisfied. Some might be thrown off by the repetitive fighting style that can get a bit old later on in the game but the mixture of shooting peculiar weapons and mutant-like enemies can have you forgetting about any kind of repetition. For anyone that enjoys tribal stories or fantasy adventures, this will truly satisfy all nerdy needs. Zeno Clash gets a Father-Mother assassinating 9/10 from me.

content:
Posted: February 21, 2014
												I have been waiting for a very long time for a fantasy-oriented game that demonstrates the level of creativity on display here.  The level of lunacy/genius demonstrated in the design of every single batshit-crazy character/creature/cultural element you encounter in this game is quite possibly best explained as "astounding," and fans of non-standard worlds are going to go nuts for this.  It feels a little bit like "Planescape vs. Capcom" or whatever mixture of crazy world-building and punching-dudes you want to think about.Oh, and the game itself is pretty fun, too, even though I certainly never expected myself to spend so much time playing a first-person fighting game (with fish-guns).  And the fighting is actually pretty fun.  But you would definitely play this as much for the atmosphere as for anything else.

content:
Posted: December 16, 2013
												Really not worth your time.The idea is great, but in execution not at all. The combat is clunky, and badly designed (you can stunlock anyone (bosses included) and can be stunlocked by anyone), the FoV makes that you will not see enemies flanking you and the lock on system is so sticky that you will always have to hit and run which I can tell you is not fun AT ALL. Pair this with an unbelievable story, extremely weird world design with nothing to like about and sub-par voice acting, this game was a real pain to get through. Zeno Clash has absolutely no value, you will be much better off with Zeno Clash II.

content:
Posted: December 18, 2014
												This is a very middle of the road kinda game. The visuals and the general style can be impressive and it has some very interesting ideas in it, but the story is lacking. It's simple, yet hard to follow. Most of the time you'll only have a vague idea of why you're doing something. Despite being only 3 hours long it has a surprising ammount of filler.First person fighting works ok... Until it doesn't. The combat is extremely repetetive but satisfying. Because "Pick up item" and "Lock on enemy" are the same button, you'll have to fight the controls every time you want to pick something up or try to run away. Guns are an odd addition. They're very out of place. Especially the grenade launcher.Overall, it's fun at first but gets old too quickly.I can't give it a score higher than "Meh" out of 10.5/10

number of helpful: 2 of 6 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 29, 2013
												Zeno Clash is very unique game but will you want to play it ? In Zeno Clash you plays as Ghat. Hes on the run from his brothers and sisters after he kills Father Mother. The story is simple enough you would understand but overall the game feels lacking. The story in itself is quite good and the twist ending does keep things fresh. But now about the gameplay. The gameplay uses melee combat to youre advanted. You bassicly lock onto an enemy and then you beat him up. Of course there are guns you can use but those are worthless because enemys rush you so fast you wont have time to reload them. Overall Zeno Clash is a fresh spin to the FPS genre but i felt that it got boring after a while and the difficulty spikes are a great dissapointment . Overall if you can get it while its on sale go for it but for full price just skip it. I give Zeno clash a 6/10

												This game seems like it's trying to tell some sort of strange, twisted story of a world filled with grime, dust, violence, and vomitous vermin. The voice acting is terrible. The camera bobs and weaves in nausea-inducing undulations - if they spent half as much time correcting the game's motion sickness that the developers seem to have spent putting the little hairs on weird creature models and putting the fine touches on the woman's afro, it would have improved the game tremendously.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 24, 2015
												I don't know why this game get so much hype. Maybe it was OK for 2009, maybe. I got this on a bundle and have been determined to beat it more than once. The problem is its boring. The story is not engaging, the voice acting is awful, and the combat is clunky. As far as I can tell this game was only rated so high because of its wacky visuals. Woo. This is a point to point brawler. You walk some you fight some dudes. You walk some more you fight some more dudes. There are no alternate paths to explore and there will be invisible walls stopping you at every turn. Intermixed with the fighting and walking are "cut scenes". In these the ♥♥♥♥♥♥ voice actors force out their bizarre dialog in such a way you can tell they are confused by what they are saying.The combat is crap. Step forward a little and punch. Either a 3 punch combo by holding left mouse or a strong attack on right mouse. There is also a dodge by pressing space bar and an arrow key while locked into melee. I never found a use for it though. Sure it gives you a chance to counter but it was hard to time right. It was much easier to take a step back, wait for the attack animation to end then walk back up and spam mouse one holds. This tactic works on every character until the end of the game. Trying to use strong attack pretty much always resulted in me getting hit before my attack would launch. Now don't let this make you think I had difficulty with this, I was owning every boring clunky fight. They added some additional fight mechanics towards the end of the game. I don't remember what they were though because I didn't use them.I eventually just gave up my quest to beat this♥♥♥♥♥♥game at the end. I beat the first round of guys easily taking minimal damage. The problem was the two guys on the roof shooting me with crossbows. All I could fight back with was a wildly inaccurate grenade launcher. I tried to lob a couple grenades up at them but the just picked me off easily with shot after shot of highly damaging, rapid fire, homing cross bow shot. I tried to dodge and lob another grenade. Only to watch the ♥♥♥♥ing cross bow bolt follow me and hit me.This is where I gave up. This game isn't worth it, I don't care about the weird♥♥♥♥♥ending or in fact any part about the story what so ever. 4/10, it works, the visuals are cool enough to make you stop and look around for a few seconds, everything else sucks.

content:
Posted: October 26, 2015
												The game was ok, it had it's moments of fun but in the end the combat is to sticky, the story is really non-existant and you figure out the plot twist about 15 minutes into the game and then spend the rest of the game grinding through combat that gets harder and harder. Normally I would say that combat getting harder is a good thing, but in this case they make it harder by adding more enemies into each fight, the designers knew that their really clunky combat system does badly with multiple enemies, its really easy to get trapped in a corner and beaten while someone shoots you from a distance. I finished the game in under 4 hours and about 30% of that time I was trying to make the combat system work smoothly, I dislike broken combat a great deal. Probably an hour or more of the game is taken up with just sitting there and barely doing anything. It tried to be different and it almost succeeded. In the end, I don't think its worth even $10, maybe $5 or throw it in for free with some other game.

content:
Posted: July 24, 2015
												I don't know why this game get so much hype. Maybe it was OK for 2009, maybe. I got this on a bundle and have been determined to beat it more than once. The problem is its boring. The story is not engaging, the voice acting is awful, and the combat is clunky. As far as I can tell this game was only rated so high because of its wacky visuals. Woo. This is a point to point brawler. You walk some you fight some dudes. You walk some more you fight some more dudes. There are no alternate paths to explore and there will be invisible walls stopping you at every turn. Intermixed with the fighting and walking are "cut scenes". In these the ♥♥♥♥♥♥ voice actors force out their bizarre dialog in such a way you can tell they are confused by what they are saying.The combat is crap. Step forward a little and punch. Either a 3 punch combo by holding left mouse or a strong attack on right mouse. There is also a dodge by pressing space bar and an arrow key while locked into melee. I never found a use for it though. Sure it gives you a chance to counter but it was hard to time right. It was much easier to take a step back, wait for the attack animation to end then walk back up and spam mouse one holds. This tactic works on every character until the end of the game. Trying to use strong attack pretty much always resulted in me getting hit before my attack would launch. Now don't let this make you think I had difficulty with this, I was owning every boring clunky fight. They added some additional fight mechanics towards the end of the game. I don't remember what they were though because I didn't use them.I eventually just gave up my quest to beat this♥♥♥♥♥♥game at the end. I beat the first round of guys easily taking minimal damage. The problem was the two guys on the roof shooting me with crossbows. All I could fight back with was a wildly inaccurate grenade launcher. I tried to lob a couple grenades up at them but the just picked me off easily with shot after shot of highly damaging, rapid fire, homing cross bow shot. I tried to dodge and lob another grenade. Only to watch the ♥♥♥♥ing cross bow bolt follow me and hit me.This is where I gave up. This game isn't worth it, I don't care about the weird♥♥♥♥♥ending or in fact any part about the story what so ever. 4/10, it works, the visuals are cool enough to make you stop and look around for a few seconds, everything else sucks.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 3, 2014
												I dreaded this moment for a long time. Zeno Clash. Oh my god, Zeno Clash. I don't even know what to say more. This is the most bat♥♥♥♥♥♥insane game I have played. Story takes us to the past (future?) to the Zenozoic. Our hero, Gath, is dead. But he is not, and he killed some being called father-mother, and now half of the friggin world hates him, so he runs away, while having shroom infused dreams of his master which is also dead. And that my friends is not a spoiler. Thats 5 seconds of the game. I won't tell anything more about the story, because for starters its quite good, and besides it doesnt make any ♥♥♥♥ing sence. At all. Gameplay is as basic as it gets. We are running around in beat em up style, throu the linear levels and kicks everything until it stops moving. Here and there we will encounter some kind of diversity (which boils down to doing exacly the same thing, but with weapon). Its a classic beat em up with fps POV. Thats the whole shmuck here! That being said, ZC is HAAAARD. First stages are quite easy, even on harder difficulties, but after about hour in, when all of our moves are unlocked to us (and to our enemies), it gets really insane. AI is really good, it tries to play on our disadvantages by ganging up on us, dodging, blocking, all that kind of stuff. Even weapons can't help us, when we have low health and we get surrounded. And don't even get me started on the whole "tower" thing (its basically a survival mode), when they really got carried away with difficulty spike. Graphics... dear lord. Okay, for starters they are really colorful and pleasant for the eyes. We rarelly see any colorless or featureless NPC's or areas. The textures are really well done, sharp and neat, even thou the game is quite old. But then comes the models itself, and the game breaks itself. I mean, jeez, dev team of ZC feed on shrooms and drinks it with liquid LSD or something. Design of most places, NPC's, backgrounds, everything is bizzare and for the most part, ugly as hell. Imagine a person with american football shape head, big ears and nose, and torso the size of half of his head. And thats the most "plain" look anyway. My god, we're they doing some heavy drugs while developing this. And the whole game is like that. Music is nice. They are upbeat loops, invigorating us to kick some bizzare♥♥♥♥♥ Here and there we can also hear some slow, almost depresing tunes, mostly in cases of "despair" of our hero. Music TBH is the most powerful aspect of the game whatsoever. Sounds are also nice. Punching sounds natural, groaning sounds natural, and the "vs" screen have this little "pow" sound which gives a vibe of an epic fight. This game is quite honestly really well made. They mixed dead genre with new and modern look, gave it nice story and great gameplay and throwed in. I would definitely reccomend this game to all peeps who loved arcade beat em ups. And to those, which loves bizzare, almost surreal feel of the game. If you dont like those thou, you probably would like to spend your cash somewhere else. Besides, the game is quite hard, and definitely not for ones with slow reflexes. Nevertheless, its worth having Zeno Clash in your library. At least as long as you have patience to beat it. Zawisza out.

content:
Posted: October 16, 2015
												Bad voice acting, wonky gameplay, decent graphics (for the time). The story is... Fine, I guess, although nothing brilliant, but the clunky nature of the gameplay (you can't hit them if they are charging a heavy attack, but they can do that to you, really? Bad hit detection in general, slow and repetitive combat, poor AI and pathfinding, you can run past your enemies walk off a "barricade" and then get stuck because you can't jump back to the previous section and so cannot kill the enemies to progress, you can hear the hitting sound without doing any damage, if somehow the AI manages to gang up on you you can die in almost no time, since you keep getting stunned and can't land hits before they do, counter-attacks often do not register and so on and so forth), makes it a very unenjoyable experience. It's also really short, 1/3 of the game done in little more than 1 hour.A very forgettable experience, which I cannot recommend to anyone.

number of helpful: 3 of 9 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 18, 2014
												Regardless of some of the games shortcomings, this game is highly enjoyable with a very pleasurable 1st-person brawler experience makes for some very solid gameplay that is refreshing to enjoy.I want to get right into things and talk about the combat first. The combat is fun and is surprisingly fluid. Probably one of my biggest issues with the combat system is the enemies invicible times. Enemies can always override your attacks but there's a lot of times when enemies will commit to a attack and are completely invincible. Making it so you take unncessary damage and it kind of ruins the flow of the game I found. Sometimes you can't even dodge their attack when executing a perfect dodge to counterattack. But overrall the combat is fair game.In the combat you are either using your bare hands to beat the living snot out of your enemies in a awesome intense fashion, or you're picking their health off with a gun from afar.The combat keeps it very simple with the controls but also makes for some intense fighting. It's really hard to explain how the combat controls work via text over doing a live commentary for example and talking about how they work in the game itself. But the game has a what I'd say fair learning curve with a stiff challenge you may not be prepared for in skill yet. But ultimately you'll learn how to conquer your foes even if it has you going back a chapter or two to do some training. Which really isn't that big of an issue since the fighting in this game is fun as heck. You'll give your old enemies the one-two-puncharoo and you'll pick up some knew combat techniques (skill specifically, the game locks some advanced combat early game. But all results in combat are based on your skill and use of the controls) and be trained enough to learn how to take out tougher enemies.I liked the soundtrack, it wasn't perfect. But it was nice and I can remember a few specific tracks that fit my fancy. They fit the fighting scenarios well and they really helped you get into fights, I give them credit for making soundtracks that pumped me up some in a lot of these battles and levels.The art directive was really strange, I wouldn't say it was memorable or enjoyable persay. But it was interesting to look at and look forward to for their next environments and people. Though I had an issue with the level designs. In the sense of the backgrounds. Everything a little above level eye sight which would be the middle of the screen was sickingly blurry. It was like this in pretty much every level. I had to keep my eyes on the ground and the middle of the screen or I felt sick.The voice acting was poor in it's own right, but that doesn't really matter. Same with the story, the story was kind of weird and didn't really make any sense besides your were just running away from your home because of your actions. But the story and voice acting and art and some of the blurry vision in the levels really pale in how good the action in this game was. I know I didn't do a good job at explaining the combat at all, i'd definitely suggest watching a video of it on youtube. But the action brawling in this game is really good fun. It was an experience I was happy to partake in and i'm glad I played this game. I got this game through trading for it, for it was in a bundle. I heard the game was good and I gave it a try and i'm now here to tell you that is indeed the case. I'd suggest getting it price cut of at least above 5 bucks. Anything below that is just criminal. Though this game is priced at $9.99 or your regional equilivalent and I'd say this game is worth the full price. It's good and I can't say i'd feel bad if I dropped ten bucks on this game. Because even after beating the game there's a challenge mode in-which you beat the crap out of people for numerous amounts of floors and that's jolly good fun too. So anyways, Zeno Clash. If you don't mind a game that is highly action-oriented and with great combat and that's very fast-paced and alive. Get this game, it's really enjoyable.Anyways, thank you for reading my review. I hope you found it helpful for considering if you want to purchase this game or not, have a good one.

												This game is intense. Possibly due to the fact that every fight I barely make it out because I can't remember the combos, but in any case I love the world and bizarreness of it. It reminds me of the stuff my friends and I would come up with way back when we had... Competitive tobacco smoking sessions. I've seen the reports of repetitiveness but I'm just not actually /seeing/ it myself. Yeah there are repeating character fights but they don't feel recycled as I was lead to believe. And I tend to be rather picky about that so it says something.

												Zeno Clash is a uniquely set game with an original storyline. The actors voices are quite funny (done badly) but the graphics are decent for its time. The characters are very original but the combat engine is brutal. Switching from one attacker to the next is badly controlled and running from an opponent is badly designed. It would be better if it was an open world game and you weren't stuck in an arena every time you fought... The game isn't bad but I think its broken.

number of helpful: 3 of 10 people (30%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 13, 2013
												When you think of "First Person Brawler," you might think "Oh, that's actually a pretty good idea!" This game isn't the answer to that. If it had multiplayer, I could fully understand the appeal, but it doesn't even have multiplayer, all it has is a madly hard-to-follow story and interesting visuals. That's all it's merits. Sure it's in a nice niche of quick-time events that you just have to know when to do so, and it might take a fair bit of skill to really get good at it, but you don't have time for that. The entire game feels no different from Call of Duty in the way that along the story, you move forward and OOPS YOU CAN'T GO ANY FARTHER BECAUSE MONSTERS, and then it's just fight after fight, a cutscene that makes zero sense, rinse and repeat, and then the game's over; the only real difference being that in Zeno Clash the guns aren't even guns and your companion does nothing to help you even though she's probably capable. She just stares at you during your short-lived fights and makes no effort to actually drive the thing.All in all, the game is too lacking to get a "yes" from me.

												Do you like to get immersed in the stories videogames tell? Well....... you won't like this game. The horrible voice acting makes it seem fake and just horrible. The game is level based where you have one fight then the level is over, where you don't get to keep the weaponry you had into the next level, sometimes starting a level already holding another completely different weapon. Weaponry against some enemies are extremely underpowered, whereas some enemies they're overpowered. YOU HAVE NO AMMO COUNT, just have to reload after every few shots. It lacks original menus making the game feel like a Half-life 2 mod, which there is no problem with that, but usually mods are free, which is about what this game is worth.

												One of my favorite games ever.I loved it because it innovated and took fighting to FPS view - it might not have done so amazingly, but it felt great because it was new and fresh.But the combat is only what led me into the game - not what made me stay. The story and design is what made me stay.Sure - the voice acting is pretty sub par - but with what they got, they painted a amazingly detailed and enthralling world.The characters are unique and interesting and the overall story (once pieces falls into place) is really intruiging.Loved the first one - definitly a recommend - provided you can hold on once the combat charm starts wearing off. if nothing else, do pick this up at a sale.

Posted: November 2, 2010
												An absolute gorgeous first-person brawler. The character designs and artwork is straight out of a Jim Henson movie like the Dark Crystal. The fighting mechanics are thought out but never too complicated.  The story mode is very short, about 5 hours or so don't expect an epic story. Speaking of story, this is one of the most bizarre games I have EVER played. Check out the demo, I'm sure you won't regret it.

Posted: October 6, 2013
												This game reminds my of why I fell in love with older games-- COMPLETELY unique chracters, world/atmosphere, andmonster/s etc.I got used to the 1st person fighting pretty quickly, but it can be a bit challenging at times and at first.If you like completely unique game experience with such an odd world/etc, then this game is def. for you! Story is not very long, I beat this on normal/medium in like 8hrs, but hey-- it's an older game with improved graphics, so it is still fun!9/5/10, 4.5/5 stars

For those who like to punish themselves, there is a challenge mode which should prove taxing for even the best.

Posted: December 20, 2010
												Super unique, first-person brawler indie title. The music is odd, story is odd, voice acting is odd, and environments are odd. And yet, I find it charming. Everything is so alienating, but it works to this game's strengths. Makes it stand out, which is probably the reason such a far out concept didn't totally flop.It's interesting, and worth a full playthrough. Gameplay stays fresh throughout with the well-paced difficulty curve, and varied AI for each enemy. Plus, it's been updated several months after release with some new moves and enemies (the update coincided with the XBLA release of Zeno Clash Ultimate or whatever it was called. They're the same, though, so don't worry.)Definitely worth it if it's on sale, though I'm fine having payed $20.
